notes.family_history:
Maternal HIstory :
Recurrent fevers and rash
Onset 15 years - diagnosed as TRAPS 
Mental health issues 
Trialled Etanercept – good response but stopped in pregnancy
Trial anikinra – adherence difficult and variable engagement with services
Genetics 
TNFRSF1A (exons 2,3,4,5) – no mutation (CHW 2003)
MEFV (exon 10b (663-779) and exon 2 (92-242)) – no mutations (CHW 2003)
notes.indication_for_referral:
2008-12-03
Autoinflammatory – recurrent fevers and abdominal / joint pain
Onset – 8 months of age
Episodes occurring 1-5 /month – avg fortnightly
Start with fever 24-48 hrs
Urticarial plaques that are tender with no migration  Rash lasts 2-3 days
Associated malaise, myalgia, abdominal pain, pain in joints (toe walking), headache
No ocular inflammation
Comorbid issues
Ex 31/40 SGA baby – now growing ~25th centile for height & weight
Significant behavioural issues – ADHD / ODD
Recurrent otitis media – conductive hearing loss (Sept 2018)

Prescreening immune function 
Neutrophilia during attacks, no cytopenias
No LFT or renal function abnormalities
Lymph subsets & Igs normal (not hypergam)
Complement normal, QuantiFERON neg
ANA, ENA negative
Humoral immune function not yet tested

notes.family_history: Family history – father prostate cancer. Mother thyroid, uterine and adrenal cancer.
notes.indication_for_referral:
Classical Kaposi sarcoma. Fatigue, sleep disorder, chronic diarrhoea. Severe steroid-dependent childhood asthma.
Family history – father prostate cancer. Mother thyroid, uterine and adrenal cancer.
notes.medical_history: Severe steroid dependent asthma. Cushing's syndrome secondary to steroid use. Autistic spectrum disorder. Chronic diarrhoea with inflammation on biopsy consistent with mild colitis. Chronic fatigue. Brain fog. Polyarhralgia no synovitis. Classical Kaposi's sarcoma with lymph node involvement.

nonstandard_features.label: Decreased CTLA4 expression on Tregs; cryptic splicing detected on RNAseq and RT-PCR

notes.indication_for_referral: Features consistent with monocytopenia and mycobacterial infection (MonoMAC) syndrome with disseminated MAC infection, monocytopaenia, HPV-associated skin warts and Bowen's disease, and myelodysplasia. Previously identified variant of uncertain significance in GATA2 (c.351C>G) with possible effect on splicing.
